extends java.lang.Object

      Vector constructor initialize the field of the vector

      • get

        public double get(int i)
        Returns the element at the specified index. An index ranges from 0 to length() - 1.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the desired element.
        Returns:
        the desired element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is not in the range 0 to length()-1.

      • set

        public void set(int i,
       double value)
        Set the value of element at the specified index. An index ranges from 0 to length() - 1.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the desired element.
        value - the value to assign.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is not in the range 0 to length()-1.

      • equiv

        public boolean equiv(Vector v,
            double tol)
        A method to compare the equality of a given Vector with current Vector. an tolerant value is given for checking the equality.
        Parameters:
        v - a given Vector to check equality with current one
        tol - a tolerant value for assuming equality
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the size of given Vector v does not have same size as current Vector

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A method for formating Vector's data into a string, for each element of Vector, format it as a 7 decimal double number.

        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formated string
